alert.note: Alert for Clark; Dallas; Garland; Grant; Hot Spring; Pike (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 9:58AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Clark, east central Pike, west central Grant, western Dallas, south central Garland and Hot Spring Counties through 1030 AM CDT... At 958 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Amity to near Okolona to 6 miles south of Beirne. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hot Springs... Arkadelphia... Gurdon... Amity... Caddo Valley... Sparkman... Whelen Springs... Beirne... Gum Springs in Clark County... Halfway... Richwoods... DeGray Lake State Park... Rockwell... Donaldson... Friendship... Bismarck... Alpine... Lono... Tulip... Curtis... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for central Arkansas. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until noon CDT for southwestern Arkansas. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for central and southwestern Arkansas.

area.areaDesc: Clark; Dallas; Garland; Grant; Hot Spring; Pike
